intro: Aethionema thomasianum, commonly known as the Thomasian rockcress, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring, which are arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white hair, giving them a silvery appearance. Aethionema thomasianum is well adapted to arid conditions and is often found in coastal or mountainous areas.
